alert.note: Alert for Chaffee (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 07 at 5:08PM MDT until August 07 at 6:15PM MDT by NWS Pueblo
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 615 PM MDT THIS EVENING FOR SOUTH CENTRAL CHAFFEE COUNTY... At 508 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain have moved away from the warned area. However, flash flooding is likely ongoing across Poncho Pass. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Law enforcement at 323 pm reported a large boulder had fallen into the roadway of Highway 285. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Poncha Pass and Poncha Springs. This includes the following high risk locations... Highway 285 south of Poncha Springs to Poncha Pass. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
